TopicTitle: Kerbal to rescue is not to be found, and IVA graphic issues

Articles.Content:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/tkbouoxjd3vtrz5/2016-02-08_00003.jpg?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/3sgaqoozu9b9pi2/2016-02-08_00004.jpg?dl=0

mods:

EVE

distant object

KIS/KAS

kerbal engineer

stock bug fixes

Atmos trajectories

KAC

 

The guy is not in the solar system and the mission has not expired yet, it says hes not in a wreck, and there are 0 eva's active in the tracking center.I have since accepted another rescue mission (where he is in a wreck) and he is showing up in an orbit.

I'm going to cancel the mission and count it as a loss, its whatever, but is this issue known? 

Id also like to point out in an unrelated issue that cockpit IVA's display odd graphical issues outside the windows often, and there is nothing attached to the front part of the vessel which is the Mk2 pointy command module:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cfsdpmp64nj8s8t/2016-02-05_00008.jpg?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/tp1kak3u6ctgxg8/2016-02-05_00012.jpg?dl=0

Has anyone encountered this?

Thank you in advance!

 

 

Edited February 8, 2016 by fireblade274

I have encountered this problem before.  This error is a corrupted save file.  In the save, you will discover that the Kerbal is still 'there' but in a different state of being.  There's a number value to where he's located: 0,1,2... depending on which vehicle seat, eva (I think), etc.  I do not recall the suggested process to correct the issue, but that after many attempts of editing the save file and reloading the game I just got frustrated and started a new save.

 

Good luck!
